text.text_translated:
In the 18th and 19th centuries, there were two main ideas about dreams.
One idea said dreams show us secret things. These are things we do not know about. A man named Freud had this idea. He said our dreams tell us things. If we understand our dreams, we can understand our secret feelings. We can also understand our problems.
But the other idea was very different. It said dreams are just brain activity. This activity is not planned. The brain does this when it puts memories in order. These are memories from the day.
When we wake up, we remember pictures and feelings. These pictures and feelings have no reason. We try to understand them. So we make a story about them.
